title: Sam Pinder
text:
Sam Pinder (born 15 February 1979 in <a href="Taupo">Taupo</a>, New Zealand), is a <a href="Scotland">Scottish</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player formerly of <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> and <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a>. Pinder played at <a href="Scrum-half%20%28rugby%20union%29">Scrum-Half</a>.
The player qualified to represent the Scottish national rugby union team as his grandmother came from Port Seton near Edinburgh. The scrum half played for Scotland against the Barbarians at Murrayfield on 31 May 2006. Pinder got his first of his two international caps on tour for Scotland on 10 June 2006 in Durban; the second on 17 June 2006 in Port Elizabeth; both against South Africa.
He is a Glasgow Warriors <a href="centurion">centurion</a> having played over 100 matches for the club. He left the club in 2009 to go to Hong Kong where he has been employed in various roles with the Hong Kong RFU notably as running their Sevens team and as being the Director of Rugby at Causeway Bay RFC.
